message_1:
Identify the functional groups present in the following compound and predict the products of its reaction with hydrochloric acid: 

C6H5CH2CH2OH
message_2:
The compound C6H5CH2CH2OH is known as phenethyl alcohol. It contains the following functional groups:

1. Aromatic ring (Phenyl group): C6H5
2. Aliphatic chain: CH2CH2
3. Alcohol group: OH

When phenethyl alcohol reacts with hydrochloric acid (HCl), the alcohol group (-OH) will be protonated, and a substitution reaction will occur, replacing the -OH group with a -Cl group. The product of this reaction will be phenethyl chloride (C6H5CH2CH2Cl) and water (H2O).
